title: How to Sell a Part in Need for Speed

methods.name: Selling Parts in Need for Speed: World (PC)

steps.headline: Launch the game and log in.
steps.description: You can launch the game from the desktop or Start menu. Once launched, log into your account. A progress bar will then be displayed as the game tries to download any required updates from the Internet.

steps.headline: Open the NFS World.
steps.description: As soon as all the updates are downloaded, the “Play” button on the dialogue box will activate. Click it to open NFS World. When the game has finished loading, press “Enter” or any other key to start. Your NFSW profile details will be displayed.

steps.headline: Click “Enter World” to enter the NFS World in Free Roam mode.
steps.description: Free Roam is a mode in the game (and most other modern NFS titles) that allows you to tour the city for familiarization or to find races you can engage in.

steps.headline: Hit “H” on your keyboard once you are in Free Roam mode.
steps.description: This will take you to your Safe House. A Safe House on NFSW is a facility where you can buy new cars and manage them.

steps.headline: Open the AfterMarket Shop.
steps.description: On the Safe House Menu, click “Customization” and then select “AfterMarket Shop.” This will open a page where you can purchase or sell parts for or from your car. There are two small windows on the AfterMarket Shop page that allow you to view purchasable items and items that are already installed on the car. The window labelled “Inventory” allows you to view and sell parts already on your car while the one marked “Store” allows you to purchase new parts. Click the round button that links the two windows to toggle between them.

steps.headline: View the categories of body parts you can sell.
steps.description: Activate the Inventory window by clicking the round button and then clicking the downward-facing arrow on it to view the categories of body parts that are already installed on the vehicle.

steps.headline: Select a part to sell from the category.
steps.description: For instance, to sell a Level 2 Lowering Kit, select “Lowering Kit” from the categories. This will display all lowering kits available on the car.

steps.headline: Sell the part.
steps.description: Drag the part to sell onto the Sell Parts tab. The Sell Parts tab is found at the bottom right of the Aftermarket page. A confirmation dialog box will appear, asking you to confirm that you want to sell the part. Click “Yes.” The part will be removed and your cash balance incremented with the value of the part. Press “Escape” to exit to the Customization menu and “Escape” again to return to Free Roam.

methods.name: Selling Parts in Need for Speed: Shift (PC)

steps.headline: Launch the game from the Start Menu.
steps.description: Start Button >> Games >> Need for Speed Shift. You can also launch it from the desktop by double-clicking its icon, if you have it there. When the game finishes loading, the player profile selection page will be displayed.

steps.headline: Press “Enter” to select the currently highlighted player profile.
steps.description: You can also use the Up and Down Arrow keys to scroll through the available player profiles and select a different one. As soon as the profile loads, the game will display the Main Menu.

steps.headline: Open the Upgrades menu.
steps.description:
Select “Career” by pressing Enter then use the Up and Down Arrow keys to scroll to “Upgrades.”
In the Upgrades section, you can buy or sell both visual and performance upgrades from or for your car(s).

steps.headline: Select the level of the part to sell.
steps.description: Use the Left and Right Arrow keys to  select  the level of parts you want to install or sell. The options are Stage 1, Stage 2, Stage 3, and so on. For instance, to sell a Brake Stage 1 upgrade: Scroll to Stage 1 and press Enter to open the Stage 1 upgrades menu.

steps.headline: Select the part to sell.
steps.description: From the Stage menu, scroll downwards to select the part you want to sell. A confirmation dialog box will appear asking if you wish to sell the part will appear. For example, to sell a Brake Stage 1 upgrade, scroll to the part and press Enter to select it.

steps.headline: Select “Yes” to confirm.
steps.description: The part will be removed from your car and your cash balance incremented with the value of the part. Press “Escape” repeatedly to exit from the Upgrades return to the game’s Main Menu.

text:
Selling Parts in Need for Speed: World (PC) Launch the game and log in. You can launch the game from the desktop or Start menu. Once launched, log into your account. A progress bar will then be displayed as the game tries to download any required updates from the Internet. Open the NFS World. As soon as all the updates are downloaded, the “Play” button on the dialogue box will activate. Click it to open NFS World. When the game has finished loading, press “Enter” or any other key to start. Your NFSW profile details will be displayed. Click “Enter World” to enter the NFS World in Free Roam mode. Free Roam is a mode in the game (and most other modern NFS titles) that allows you to tour the city for familiarization or to find races you can engage in. Hit “H” on your keyboard once you are in Free Roam mode. This will take you to your Safe House. A Safe House on NFSW is a facility where you can buy new cars and manage them. Open the AfterMarket Shop. On the Safe House Menu, click “Customization” and then select “AfterMarket Shop.” This will open a page where you can purchase or sell parts for or from your car. There are two small windows on the AfterMarket Shop page that allow you to view purchasable items and items that are already installed on the car. The window labelled “Inventory” allows you to view and sell parts already on your car while the one marked “Store” allows you to purchase new parts. Click the round button that links the two windows to toggle between them. View the categories of body parts you can sell. Activate the Inventory window by clicking the round button and then clicking the downward-facing arrow on it to view the categories of body parts that are already installed on the vehicle. Select a part to sell from the category. For instance, to sell a Level 2 Lowering Kit, select “Lowering Kit” from the categories. This will display all lowering kits available on the car. Sell the part. Drag the part to sell onto the Sell Parts tab. The Sell Parts tab is found at the bottom right of the Aftermarket page. A confirmation dialog box will appear, asking you to confirm that you want to sell the part. Click “Yes.” The part will be removed and your cash balance incremented with the value of the part. Press “Escape” to exit to the Customization menu and “Escape” again to return to Free Roam. Selling Parts in Need for Speed: Shift (PC) Launch the game from the Start Menu. Start Button >> Games >> Need for Speed Shift. You can also launch it from the desktop by double-clicking its icon, if you have it there. When the game finishes loading, the player profile selection page will be displayed. Press “Enter” to select the currently highlighted player profile. You can also use the Up and Down Arrow keys to scroll through the available player profiles and select a different one. As soon as the profile loads, the game will display the Main Menu. Open the Upgrades menu. Select “Career” by pressing Enter then use the Up and Down Arrow keys to scroll to “Upgrades.”
In the Upgrades section, you can buy or sell both visual and performance upgrades from or for your car(s). Select the level of the part to sell. Use the Left and Right Arrow keys to  select  the level of parts you want to install or sell. The options are Stage 1, Stage 2, Stage 3, and so on. For instance, to sell a Brake Stage 1 upgrade: Scroll to Stage 1 and press Enter to open the Stage 1 upgrades menu. Select the part to sell. From the Stage menu, scroll downwards to select the part you want to sell. A confirmation dialog box will appear asking if you wish to sell the part will appear. For example, to sell a Brake Stage 1 upgrade, scroll to the part and press Enter to select it. Select “Yes” to confirm. The part will be removed from your car and your cash balance incremented with the value of the part. Press “Escape” repeatedly to exit from the Upgrades return to the game’s Main Menu.
